facts: The narrator and Ántonia's interactions at the prairie-dog town evolve from observing owls and discussing the habitat to actively exploring and digging into the holes.

Later, in Chapter 7, they return to a prairie-dog town and decide to explore it more actively by digging into one of the holes. This progression shows how their engagement with the prairie-dog town changes from passive observation to active exploration over time.
